alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 09 at 8:07AM CDT until June 09 at 8:02PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Washita River near Clinton affecting Washita and Custer Counties.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC039-149-100115- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.W.0009.000000T0000Z-220610T0102Z/ /CLIO2.1.ER.220608T1320Z.220608T1730Z.220609T1902Z.NO/ 807 AM CDT Thu Jun 9 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Washita River near Clinton. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Approximately 3 thousand acres of rural lands are covered by depths up to 2 feet... from areas near the mouth of Barnitz Creek... to near Clinton in Custer County... and downstream to near the town of Cloud Chief in Washita County. Depths may be greater at locations where small streams enter the Washita River valley below Clinton. Some farmsteads are flooded and others isolated by water over local roads. Some farm levees may be overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The Washita River is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
